channel.title: Mixed Drinks
channel.description:
So, I need some help. I have 1 liter of Vodka, and 1 liter of Caribbean Rum, along with a few bears. Myself and a two friends intend on getting absolutely blasted tomorrow.
Thing is, hard liquor doesn't settle very well with me. By the time I get a nice buzz, I am barfing very soon after. Beer, on the other hand, gives me a nice long happy buzz...but I'm just about out of beer thanks to the weekend and it gives me stomach aches anyways :(
My biggest problem is simply the taste of the liquor alone, in shots etc. The first couple shots are fine but eventually it just tastes like absolute shit, right up until I can't taste anymore.
So, we all agreed we would try out some mixed drinks. And, I need some suggestions.
Preferably ones that aren't too expensive to find the liquids for. Remember, are goal is to get absolutely smashed, but still have a great time.
Any good mixtures would be much appreciated :)

item.title: Mixed Drinks
item.dc:creator: @Ollie Ollie
item.description:
@Ollie wrote:

I tried .5L vodka and .5L cherry aid, couldn’t even taste vodka got smashed after drinking it in half hour! haha

Read full topic

item.title: Mixed Drinks
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Phaze One, post:26, topic:346324”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=442705.msg3253331#msg3253331 date=1277933200]

On mythbusters they proved that drinking hard drinks, actually are better for you, and don’t provide as bad as a hangover.

Try oj with vodka

[/quote]old information is old. The key is to not mix spirits, the stronger and cleaner it is, the smaller chance of hangover is. Combine this with water every now and then, and you’re on easy street.

However you might not want the constant horrid taste of spirits, unless it’s shots. I suggest vodka with red bull. Personally I don’t mind the taste of plain vanilla vodka but it’s not to everyone’s likings.[/quote]I hate vodka, but i hate red bull even more! Give me a nice bottle of whiskey and i’m fine

Read full topic

On mythbusters they proved that drinking hard drinks, actually are better for you, and don’t provide as bad as a hangover.

Try oj with vodka

[/quote]old information is old. The key is to not mix spirits, the stronger and cleaner it is, the smaller chance of hangover is. Combine this with water every now and then, and you’re on easy street.[/quote]

However you might not want the constant horrid taste of spirits, unless it’s shots. I suggest vodka with red bull. Personally I don’t mind the taste of plain vanilla vodka but it’s not to everyone’s likings.

item.title: Mixed Drinks
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

Chill your liquor to ice cold in the freezer, it helps liquor noobs a lot.

Then learn how to chase it properly. Literally swallowing ginger ale like the second you swallow the alcohol. I was a huge pussy with liquor until I started doing this with captain morgan. Plus ginger ale will help reduce nausea. Now I’m a pussy for beer cuz it takes too long

the bank:

I heard vodka and cranberry was good?

I love cranberry juice. When I tried with vodka it was disgusting.

Read full topic

item.title: Mixed Drinks
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“la­wl, post:10, topic:346324”]drink water between shots possibly?[/quote]I do. It’s a trick of the trade.

To anyone that doesn’t know: drinking water periodically while drinking will decrease the chance and severity of a hangover the next day!

I heard vodka and cranberry was good?

Read full topic

item.title: Mixed Drinks
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

I had two 24s of Canadian on Friday, but had a party Saturday, so yes I only have a few beers left.

I am aware we don’t have much to get completely SMASHED, which is why I was wondering how best to get the most out of what we have.

Thanks guys.

Read full topic

item.description:

Something simple couple of shots of port in a pint of draught guinness(coz its awesome). Don’t under estimate the mix. You shouldn’t taste the port that much though.
